SWOW-EN.name: Small World of Words (English)
SWOW-EN.citation: De Deyne, S., Navarro, D. J., Perfors, A., Brysbaert, M., & Storms, G. (2019). The "Small World of Words" English word association norms for over 12,000 cue words. Behavior Research Methods, 51(3), 987-1006.
SWOW-EN.description: Free association norms from ~12K cue words, ~90K participants

SPP.name: Semantic Priming Project
SPP.citation: Hutchison, K. A., Balota, D. A., Neely, J. H., Cortese, M. J., Cohen-Shikora, E. R., Tse, C. S., ... & Buchanan, E. (2013). The semantic priming project. Behavior Research Methods, 45(4), 1099-1114.
SPP.description: Lexical decision and naming data for 1,661 word pairs

Warriner-VAD.name: Warriner Affective Norms
Warriner-VAD.citation: Warriner, A. B., Kuperman, V., & Brysbaert, M. (2013). Norms of valence, arousal, and dominance for 13,915 English lemmas. Behavior Research Methods, 45(4), 1191-1207.
Warriner-VAD.description: Valence, arousal, and dominance ratings for ~14K words

Brysbaert-Concreteness.name: Brysbaert Concreteness Norms
Brysbaert-Concreteness.citation: Brysbaert, M., Warriner, A. B., & Kuperman, V. (2014). Concreteness ratings for 40 thousand generally known English word lemmas. Behavior Research Methods, 46(3), 904-911.

Lancaster-Sensorimotor.name: Lancaster Sensorimotor Norms
Lancaster-Sensorimotor.citation: Lynott, D., Connell, L., Brysbaert, M., Brand, J., & Carney, J. (2020). The Lancaster Sensorimotor Norms: multidimensional measures of perceptual and action strength for 40,000 English words. Behavior Research Methods, 52(3), 1271-1291.
Lancaster-Sensorimotor.description: Perceptual (6 modalities) and action (5 body parts) strength ratings for ~40K words

SUBTLEX-US.name: SUBTLEX-US Word Frequency Norms
SUBTLEX-US.citation: Brysbaert, M., & New, B. (2009). Moving beyond Kucera and Francis: A critical evaluation of current word frequency norms and the introduction of a new and improved word frequency measure for American English. Behavior Research Methods, 41(4), 977-990.
SUBTLEX-US.description: Word frequency and contextual diversity from 51 million words of film subtitles (~74K words)

Diveica-Socialness.name: Socialness Norms
Diveica-Socialness.citation: Diveica, V., Pexman, P. M., & Binney, R. J. (2021). Quantifying social semantics: An inclusive definition of socialness and ratings for 8,388 English words. Behavior Research Methods, 55, 461-473.
Diveica-Socialness.description: Socialness ratings (1-7 scale) for ~8.4K words - how related to social interactions

Brysbaert-Prevalence.name: Word Prevalence Norms
Brysbaert-Prevalence.citation: Brysbaert, M., Mandera, P., McCormick, S. F., & Keuleers, E. (2019). Word prevalence norms for 62,000 English lemmas. Behavior Research Methods, 51(2), 467-479.
Brysbaert-Prevalence.description: Percentage of people who know each word - word knowledge across population (~62K words, age-stratified)

Scott-Glasgow.name: Glasgow Norms
Scott-Glasgow.citation: Scott, G. G., Keitel, A., Becirspahic, M., Yao, B., & Sereno, S. C. (2019). The Glasgow Norms: Ratings of 5,500 words on nine scales. Behavior Research Methods, 51(3), 1258-1270.
Scott-Glasgow.description: Multi-dimensional ratings: imageability, familiarity, age of acquisition, size, gender association (~5.5K words)
